intro: Gymnosporia europaea, commonly known as European gymnosporia, is a shrub native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and spine-tipped leaves. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Gymnosporia europaea is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
